reviewText:
There are so many things wrong with this game it's insane.

1. Launched it the first time, and my pointer was moving on its own.
2. Horrible sound effects. WTF is with the narrators voice?
3. No graphics options - way tooooo dark. Use the muzzle flash as a flashlight since the one in the game doesn't work.
4. Level design doesn't even make sense.
5. Looks like the enemies were ripped from Quake and Doom.
6. Loading sceen images are clearly the result of a Google Image search.
7. Typos on the in game text.
8. FOV is about 96543164987231, instead of being 85-90.

On the flipside, there are 8 easy cheevos that you could probably get in a single playthrough in about 2 hours.

reviewText:
07/12/2015/ For those who won a key on orly: I'm also there. Meaning that I will have no regret to report any copy/paste of my review. Some of you may have experienced that with Galaxy Admirals. Do you really want to have your 10 credits revoked because you're too lazy to try the game and to write some lines?

I wanted to believe in Moonbase 332. I didn't care about the graphics but I wanted to believe in a little FPS that I could enjoy.

Moonbase 332 having been in many bundles, I got a key for myself thanks to that. I decided to give it a try yesterday because I was wondering if it would be any better than Galatic Hitman. And it is better than the latter. At least, levels are differents, you have a lot of weapons and the enemies are moving.

You're arriving in a secret base used by Austria to develop a virus that would have infected Germany. And guess who will clean it? You!

While the story isn't the plot of the year, I was immediately thrown into my biggest mistake: changing binding keys. Yep, it was still in beta. But I would have never imagined that I would loose my reload button. I couldn't reload ANY weapon. Any! I had to wait until I wasted my bullet to reload.

And the reload action.... My god, why is it so slow for the dual weapons? Even other games take less time for that.

I never understood why Zombie Nazis, walkyries with crossbows and slashers appeared in the game... or flying skulls for the matter. For a game about infected people, the developer added some paranormal stuff.

But the best? I don't know how the zombies with bazookas managed to hit me even when hidden. And I was dodging the rockets, I really was. Apparently it's vain because they're hitting you each time. That's how I managed to loose many of my lives.

Because you have 10 lives before a gameover... and you have to keep counting. Because the HUD only shows the weapons and your ammo. No health bar. You don't know if you need to reload a save or not.

About the weapons, they're nice: the shotgun is powerful through three bullets isn't enough. I couldn't enjoy two weapons because despite showing having still ammo, they refused to reload when it was at 0. I cursed that because they were among the most powerful! Yay!

I don't care about the graphics but when you see the last bonus level, you're asking yourself why it's more alive" than the main story. And in general
date: bonus levels are refreshing.\n\nAnd why did the dev ignore completely puzzles? I mean
recommended: the last bonus level showed that you could have mixed shooting and brain. But no
hoursPlayed: you're just running around to find buttons to open doors.\n\nThe big problem is also that I've crashed constantly at the end of a loading level. The only answer you'll get is "reload the autosave - problem solved". Yeah
voteText: apart that my computer is in the recommended specs and that having the message "FPSC stopped working" without any cause is hard.\n\nI would have been more positive about the game if it wasn't for the crash
helpfulPercent: some problems with enemies with bazookas and my ♥♥♥♥ed up rebinding
votesHelpful: though I think that the dev will probably patch that one.\n\nBetween Galatic Hitman and Moonbase 332
votesTotal: choose Moonbase 332 because the dev did work on the game and didn't take you as fools. But in the end
votesFunny: I can't recommend it if the game is always crashing. I really can't. Would the problem disappear
column16: you can go ahead and try it.\n\nSorry to put a "No" for this game. I really wanted to believe in the game. I was happy to see the keys in the bundle. I put it in my wishlist. In the end
column17: I still want to believe that there will some improvements though...."

reviewText: A game that makes you work to like it.\nThough an obtuse and bug-filled experimental work, Moonbase 332 does not force the user to redefine personal definitions of acceptable" but rather to  contemplate what constitutes a successful game in the first place. When distilled soley to it's lesser parts
date: it is easy to overlook the unique creative centerpiece that sits beneath the mess."

reviewText: Moonbase 332 looks like a cobbled together mess with ugly graphics, pitiful sound (whats up with the narrators voice), no graphic options and the game is way too dark. Don't know what the guy that compared this to Duke Nukem 3D was on, but this crap isn't even in the same category.

reviewText:
There is nothing special, or special about this game. Is just an FPS Creator game that no one bother in modeling or doing something custom for it. No joke, they just throw the default packs, without any sense of design. They even download a Regenerator model from RE4 and use it on the game, is this even legal?
They don't changed the main menu fonts , or any of the default fps creator stuff. Worst is that they don't even bothered in making sense of this game, is just random packs mix together,  medieval pack, space  pack, ww2 pack, no joke.  The worst insult is that they make you register to play this game. If im playing this i got it on a bundle, no one will piracy this, and for good reasons. If you want to make indi games you need to put a minimum of effort in that, and you didn't try, at all.
I played this game for 5 minutes just to warn other players not to waste time with this, this is how awful this is.

Some levels were not even tested, objects that block door partially ,and so on.

reviewText:
I really loved this game and would have loved to finished getting the easy achivements on it
BUT there are major issues at the time that prevents me so I will list what I liked and didnt like.

Good
+ I had discount voucher
+ Reminds me of Quake & Doom.


Bad
- Narrator - wth is up with this?  Text to speech thing? Why other having an narrator at all? ANNOYING
- Level Design - Textures : Poor , Layout : Random & Buggy
- Gun Accuracy :  Terrible (Atleast in steam verison .. seem to be somewhat ok in no_steam one)
- Monster Design : Looks like ripps from other games *coughs* Doom... Flying skulls
- Sound Effects : Bad
- Very Crashy: Bad files even with fresh install
- No health indicator
- Poor UI

Whatever

* one of these levels is an office... in space to this i just say YAY and Stuff"
* In one of the levels there are windows you can open
date:
you might say "how nice" I say "we are still in space..."
* Bosses are easy to get stuck thus enabling you to kill them without taking much damage (First two atleast)

To make it short for all of you whom skipped down to this directly...
Unless you have a discount voucher on 90% do not bother  as it is not worth the money.

I just MIGHT Install this again to see if they have fixed anything in a few months."

reviewText: Moonbase 332 is a arcade style fps set in space.  You have to fight and clean up genetically modified plaques that were released in a war between Germany and Austria in 2007.  There are 5 chapters with a total of 25 levels and remember to save frequently because there is no health regeneration.  It reminds me of Deadspace in the beginning.  The controls are well done, making it easy to manuver.  So far I made it to level 4 without a problem, we will see how it plays out!

reviewText:
friends, romans, countrymen and robots, lend me your ears because its me payde fore the clown here with another fantastic payde for review!

you know i would not lie to you, friends, so believe me when i say i have here a game that is both a true triumph of the human spirit, and one of the greatest pieces of art of the 21st century! now that i have experienced this game, i can see dead people and taste the rainbow! my mind has expanded to become aware of the limitless possibilities of the universe! there are not enough tissues on the planet to wipe all the tears of joy from my eyes when i think about the fact that this profound journey of the mind is available to anyone for the low price of only $3.99USD american dollars oh wow wow wow holy dogshit i can't even fully comprehend this!

let me give away a bit of the game to explain. i began the game inside the moon base not knowing where to go. i couldn't get any doors to open and it was getting a bit frustrating. i decided to make a random jump off a set of stairs, when somthing magic happened. as i fell, i left the ship and went right into the depths of space! i thought i had died, but then a message appeared telling me that i was moving on to the next level!  yes, friends, a leap of faith is what is required to advance past the first stage! it is a brilliant metaphor that doubles as sage advice to apply to your daily life.

in closing, it seems appropriate to give this game a rating of infinite stars out of 5, due to it reminding all of us about the infinite possiblities that exist in our universe and beyond. this is a true masterwork that will be studied by scholars 1000 years from now and held up as a shining example of what the human race can accomplish.


thanks for reading another payde fore review. feel free to check out the new payde fore curations group at http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PAYDEFORE for more games that have payde fore approval!
